channel.title: The Complete List of Hardware Terms And Their Definitions on Tech Terminologies
channel.description: Recent content in The Complete List of Hardware Terms And Their Definitions on Tech Terminologies

item.title: What is UPS (Uninterruptible Power Supply)?
item.description: An uninterruptible power supply (UPS) is a device that provides backup power to a computer, server, or other electronic equipment in the event of an interruption or fluctuation in the main power supply.

item.title: What is a Base Station?
item.description: A base station is a device that serves as a central hub for wireless communication in a local area network (LAN).

item.title: What is Barebones?
item.description: A barebones PC is a computer that comes with only the essential components, such as a motherboard, processor, and power supply.

item.title: What is Bare Metal?
item.description: A bare metal system is a computer that does not include an operating system or any other software, so the user must install an operating system in order to use the hardware.

item.title: What is BSB (Backside Bus)?
item.description: The backside bus (BSB) is a bus that connects the CPU to the level 2 (L2) cache on a computer.

item.title: What is APU (Analytics Processing Unit)?
item.description: An Analytics Processing Unit (APU) is a type of microprocessor that is specifically designed to handle data analytics tasks efficiently.

item.title: What is APU (Accelerated Processing Unit)?
item.description: An APU, or accelerated processing unit, is a type of processor that combines a CPU and GPU on a single chip.

item.title: What is Apple Silicon?
item.description: Apple Silicon is a line of computer processors developed and manufactured by Apple Inc.

item.title: What is a SCSI Host Adapter?
item.description: A SCSI (Small Computer System Interface) host adapter is a device that connects to a computer and allows it to communicate with SCSI devices, such as hard drives, tape drives, and scanners.

item.title: What is a Wireless Adapter?
item.description: A wireless adapter is a device that connects to a computer or other device and allows it to communicate over a wireless network.

item.title: What is a Network Adapter?
item.description: A network adapter, also known as a network interface card (NIC), is a hardware component that allows a computer to connect to a network.

item.title: What is an Adapter?
item.description: An adapter is a device that allows two different systems or devices to connect and work together.

item.title: What is Active-Matrix Liquid Crystal Display (AMLCD)
item.description: An Active-Matrix Liquid Crystal Display (AMLCD) is a type of liquid crystal display (LCD) that is used in many electronic devices, such as laptops, televisions, and smartphones.

item.title: What is Active-Matrix Organic Light-Emitting Diode (AMOLED)
item.description: Active-matrix organic light-emitting diode (AMOLED) is a type of OLED display technology in which the pixels are driven by an active matrix circuit, which consists of thin-film transistors (TFTs) and capacitors.

item.title: What is Active-Matrix?
item.description: Active-matrix is a type of display technology that is used in many electronic devices, such as laptops, smartphones, and televisions.

item.title: What is an Access Point (AP)?
item.description: An access point (AP) is a device that allows wireless devices to connect to a network using Wi-Fi or a similar wireless technology.

item.title: What is a 3D Printer?
item.description: A 3D printer is a machine that creates physical objects from digital designs.

item.title: What is a Memory Address?
item.description: A memory address is a unique identifier for a specific location in a computer’s memory.
